How can I view a transaction using the Verus command line tool?

You can view a transaction using the `z_viewtransaction` command, followed by the transaction ID. For example:
```
verus z_viewtransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"
```
Alternatively, you can also use the JSON-RPC API to view a transaction by sending a request to `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the `z_viewtransaction` method and the transaction ID as a parameter.

Examples:
```bash
> verus z_viewtransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_viewtransaction", "params": ["1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `zcbenchmark benchmarktype samplecount`
Runs a benchmark of the selected type samplecount times,
returning the running times of each sample.#### Result:
```json
[
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 },
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 }
 ...
]
```### `zcrawjoinsplit rawtx inputs outputs vpub_old vpub_new`
inputs: a JSON object mapping {note: zcsecretkey, ...}
outputs: a JSON object mapping {zcaddr: value, ...}DEPRECATED. Splices a joinsplit into rawtx. Inputs are unilaterally confidential.
Outputs are confidential between sender/receiver. The vpub_old and vpub_new values are globally public and move transparent value into or out of the confidential value store, respectively.
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
What is the purpose of the `zcbenchmark` command in Verus?

The `zcbenchmark` command is used to run a benchmark of a selected type a specified number of times, returning the running times of each sample. The command takes two arguments: `benchmarktype` and `samplecount`.

Examples:
```bash
> verus z_viewtransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_viewtransaction", "params": ["1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `zcbenchmark benchmarktype samplecount`
Runs a benchmark of the selected type samplecount times,
returning the running times of each sample.#### Result:
```json
[
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 },
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 }
 ...
]
```### `zcrawjoinsplit rawtx inputs outputs vpub_old vpub_new`
inputs: a JSON object mapping {note: zcsecretkey, ...}
outputs: a JSON object mapping {zcaddr: value, ...}DEPRECATED. Splices a joinsplit into rawtx. Inputs are unilaterally confidential.
Outputs are confidential between sender/receiver. The vpub_old and vpub_new values are globally public and move transparent value into or out of the confidential value store, respectively.
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
What information does the `zcbenchmark` command return?
The `zcbenchmark` command returns a JSON array of objects, each containing a `runningtime` field, which represents the running time of each sample.

Examples:
```bash
> verus z_viewtransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_viewtransaction", "params": ["1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `zcbenchmark benchmarktype samplecount`
Runs a benchmark of the selected type samplecount times,
returning the running times of each sample.#### Result:
```json
[
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 },
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 }
 ...
]
```### `zcrawjoinsplit rawtx inputs outputs vpub_old vpub_new`
inputs: a JSON object mapping {note: zcsecretkey, ...}
outputs: a JSON object mapping {zcaddr: value, ...}DEPRECATED. Splices a joinsplit into rawtx. Inputs are unilaterally confidential.
Outputs are confidential between sender/receiver. The vpub_old and vpub_new values are globally public and move transparent value into or out of the confidential value store, respectively.
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
What is the `zcrawjoinsplit` command used for in Verus?

The `zcrawjoinsplit` command is used to splice a joinsplit into a raw transaction. It takes five arguments: `rawtx`, `inputs`, `outputs`, `vpub_old`, and `vpub_new`. Note that this command is deprecated.

Examples:
```bash
> verus z_viewtransaction "1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_viewtransaction", "params": ["1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `zcbenchmark benchmarktype samplecount`
Runs a benchmark of the selected type samplecount times,
returning the running times of each sample.#### Result:
```json
[
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 },
 {
  "runningtime": runningtime
 }
 ...
]
```### `zcrawjoinsplit rawtx inputs outputs vpub_old vpub_new`
inputs: a JSON object mapping {note: zcsecretkey, ...}
outputs: a JSON object mapping {zcaddr: value, ...}DEPRECATED. Splices a joinsplit into rawtx. Inputs are unilaterally confidential.
Outputs are confidential between sender/receiver. The vpub_old and vpub_new values are globally public and move transparent value into or out of the confidential value store, respectively.
